Section Remarks: The majority of sore throat is viral, but there is clinical overlap between viral and bacterial infections.

Most sinusitis does not require antibiotics except:
1. Symptoms lasting longer than 7 days with purulent nasal discharge, sinus tenderness or maxillary toothache;
2. Severe symptoms and high fever more than 39oC or higher at onset of illness and lasting for more than 3 days; and
3. Worsening symptoms after initial improvement.

Most sinusitis does not require antibiotics except:
1. Symptoms lasting longer than 7 days with purulent nasal discharge, sinus tenderness or maxillary toothache;
2. Severe symptoms and high fever more than 39oC or higher at onset of illness and lasting for more than 3 days; and
3. Worsening symptoms after initial improvement.

Common Causative Agents: Streptococcus pneumoniae, Haemophilus influenzae, Moraxella catarrhalis

OR

Type: Early Syphilis: If allergic to penicillin
Remarks: Use erythromycin, if pregnant

OR
